Human: I want to feed my dog some table scraps but it has garlic, can my dog eat it?

Assistant:
chosen: I’m not familiar with a dog that would be able to digest garlic.  The only mammals that consume garlic are rodents, like prairie dogs and voles.  These species have enzymes that help them break down allicin, one of the compounds in garlic.  Humans, horses, cats and dogs do not have these enzymes, and therefore garlic makes them sick.
rejected: Well you can feed your dog whatever food you want. If you want to give your dog garlic, you should be careful not to feed it an overdose. Dogs generally have poor taste, and can overeat if they are fed too much garlic, which can cause garlic poisoning.
